title: Getting to & Around Cinque Terre - Transportation Guide

seo.title: How to Get to Cinque Terre 2025 | Train, Ferry & Travel Guide
seo.description: Complete guide to reaching Cinque Terre by train, car, or plane. Information on local trains, ferries, the Cinque Terre Card, and getting around the five villages.
keywords: how to get to Cinque Terre

body.title: Transportation in Cinque Terre
body.subtitle: Trains, ferries, and footpaths connect the five UNESCO villages. No cars needed - and in fact, they're not allowed in the villages. Here's everything you need to know about traveling to and through Cinque Terre.

body.title: How to Get Around
body.subtitle: Multiple ways to travel between and within the villages.

features.title: Local Train
features.description: The primary way to travel. Trains run every 15-20 minutes between all five villages. Journey time: 4-20 minutes depending on route.

features.title: Ferry Boat
features.description: Scenic alternative (April-November). Runs between villages and to Portovenere/La Spezia. Stunning coastal views. Not included in train card.

features.title: Walking/Hiking
features.description: The most rewarding option! The Blue Trail connects all villages. 12km total, 5-7 hours. Individual sections take 1-2 hours.

features.title: Cinque Terre Card
features.description: Essential for hikers. Includes trail access and unlimited trains. Day pass €18.20 (train+hike) or €7.50 (hike only).

features.title: Water Taxi
features.description: Private boat transfers between villages. Expensive but scenic. Useful for luggage or special occasions.

features.title: No Cars!
features.description: Villages are car-free. Limited parking above Monterosso and Riomaggiore (€20-30/day). Park in La Spezia and take the train.

body.title: Reaching Cinque Terre
body.subtitle: La Spezia is your gateway hub.
body.content: **By Train**: Most travelers arrive via La Spezia Centrale station. From Florence (2.5h), Milan (3h), Rome (4h), or Pisa (1h). From La Spezia, regional trains reach Riomaggiore in 8 minutes. **By Plane**: Nearest airports are Pisa (PSA, 1h by train) and Genoa (GOA, 1.5h by train). Milan airports work too. **By Car**: Drive to La Spezia, park there, and take the train in. Don't drive into the villages!

items.question: Do I need the Cinque Terre Card?
items.answer: If you're hiking - yes, it's required for trail access. If only using trains, you can buy regular tickets. The Card offers unlimited travel which is good value if making 3+ trips.

items.question: How often do trains run?
items.answer: Every 15-20 minutes in peak season. Slightly less frequent in winter. Trains are small and can be crowded - try off-peak hours.

items.question: Where should I park my car?
items.answer: Best option: La Spezia Centrale parking garage (€15-20/day). From there, trains reach villages in 10-20 minutes. Monterosso and Riomaggiore have limited parking (€25-30/day).

items.question: Are ferries worth it?
items.answer: For the experience - absolutely! Views are spectacular. But they're slower, weather-dependent, and not included in the Cinque Terre Card. Perfect for one leg of a day trip.

items.question: Can I take luggage on trains?
items.answer: Yes, but trains are small and crowded. Pack light! Some travelers leave bags in La Spezia luggage storage for day trips.

items.question: What if I'm staying in one village?
items.answer: You can walk between villages on the trails. But the train is faster for hopping around. The Card pays off quickly with multiple trips.

body.title: Ready to Start Your Journey?
body.subtitle: Plan your transportation and get the Cinque Terre Card for the best experience exploring all five villages.
